headline: Applied Materials Stock Drops, Chip-Equipment Rivals Fall
summary: Shares in Applied Materials (AMAT) sank after the semiconductor-equipment company issued a lower-than-expected sales outlook, citing weaker demand trends in China.  The stock recently traded about 7.2% lower, putting Applied Materials on course for its lowest close in nine months, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of semiconductor machinery manufacturer Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) fell 9.2% in the pre-market session after the company reported weak third-quarter (Fiscal Q4 2024) results. Its revenue guidance for the next quarter slightly missed. Sales growth was also underwhelming during the quarter as revenue beat by a narrow margin. The company attributed some of the weakness to headwinds which impacted sales in China.

raw.headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
raw.summary: Shares of semiconductor machinery manufacturer Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) fell 9.2% in the pre-market session after the company reported weak third-quarter (Fiscal Q4 2024) results. Its revenue guidance for the next quarter slightly missed. Sales growth was also underwhelming during the quarter as revenue beat by a narrow margin. The company attributed some of the weakness to headwinds which impacted sales in China.

headline: Why Applied Materials Stock Is Sliding Today
summary: Shares of Applied Materials (NASDAQ: AMAT), the nation's biggest manufacturer of semiconductor equipment, dropped today after it offered disappointing guidance in its fourth-quarter earnings report due to weakness in China.  The news had a similar effect on others in semiconductor manufacturing, including ASML, showing headwinds across the broad industry.  Applied Materials, which makes a wide range of products used in semiconductor manufacturing, solar, and electronics, said that revenue in the quarter rose 5% to $7.05 billion, which was ahead of estimates at $6.97 billion.

Applied Materials, which makes a wide range of products used in semiconductor manufacturing, solar, and electronics, said that revenue in the quarter rose 5% to $7.05 billion, which was ahead of estimates at $6.97 billion.
